titleStmt.title: G. B. Parker et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6409

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellincy Governor, Thos. E. Bramlett,

The undersigned petitioners say that S. W. Clark is a citizen of Pendleton County and our neighbors; We know him to be a good citizen and a law abiding man, We also think & believe that the prosecution in this case against him was prompted by personal anemosity & not for the peace and quiet & the good morals of his immediate neighborhood, We recommend him to your clemency, April 26th 1865. The prosecution is for keeping a timpling house and the fine assessed at the present April Term of the Pendleton Circuit Court is sixty dollars, which we think ought to be remitted

G B, Parker
George. W. Booker
Wm G. P Weaver
D. N. Williams
John Douglass
Squire Jett
F, M, Aulich
S C, Edwards
J. C, Garrard
N. C. Wilson
G. M. Colvin
James Wilson
C. C. Aulich
Robert Purdy
Wm McMurchy
J. T Applegate
E Wallace
J. H. Barbour
Wm. A. Pettit
G. D. Colvin
Thomas Earls
R. Stower
N. S. Dickerson
J J. Brown
James Pigg

Pendleton Cir Ct
vs
S W Clark
$60,
Petition to be released of fine
8th June 1865
